title: How to remove unwanted icons in System Preferences on your Mac
content:
Apple likes to monkey with System Preferences in macOS. Every few releases, they move things around, rename items, and change how it works. But you might have overlooked a long-running option to take some control for yourself. You can choose which preferences appear in the System Preferences app, while the ones you hide remain fully available.

Launch System Preferences, and then choose View > Customize. This flips the display to show a checkbox overlaid on every preference pane. If you uncheck a box, when you click Done_, that pane no longer appears in the app. However, you can still select it from the View menu, and you can type in its name or any of its included options in the Search field to match against it.

In Catalina and later, the Apple ID and Family Sharing items are immutable: they must remain.

IDG

Oddly, Apple lets you reduce what appears, but you cannot drag around the order of what remains. However, you can break out of Apple’s default categories by choosing View > Organize Alphabetically, which simply lists the panes from A to Z.
